summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Charter Review Commission of the City of Dallas will convene on November 14, 2023, at 6:30 PM. This meeting will be held both in-person at the Council Chambers and virtually, allowing public participation through various streaming options. The primary purpose is to discuss proposed amendments to the city charter and review best practices in charter processes.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the November 7, 2023, Charter Review Commission meeting.
2. A briefing on a charter amendment proposal for implementing ranked-choice voting, presented by Commissioner David de la Fuente.
3. A presentation by Jason Grant from the International City/County Management Association (ICMA) discussing charter review processes and best practices.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will include significant discussions on the ranked-choice voting proposal, which could impact future electoral processes in Dallas. The ICMA presentation aims to provide insights into effective charter review methodologies, potentially influencing the commission's recommendations.

**Action Items**:  
The commission will seek approval for the meeting minutes and will deliberate on the ranked-choice voting proposal. Additionally, feedback and insights from the ICMA presentation may lead to future policy recommendations regarding charter amendments. The meeting may also involve an executive session to discuss legal and strategic matters related to the agenda items.
